intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to consume a SOAP Web Service by creating source and view models based on the Web Service WSDL.

description.b: Follow the steps below to create a Teiid Model Project

subitem.label: Launch New Teiid Model Project Wizard

subitem.description:
1) Specify unique project name
2) Click Next > twice to get to Model Project Options page
3) Check folders you wish the wizard to create in your project
4) Click Finish

description.b: Follow the steps below to create an ODA Web Service connection profile using the WSDL URL and end-point information.

subitem.label: Launch Create SOAP Connection Profile Wizard

subitem.description:
1) Specify unique name and optional description and click Next >
2) Enter a WSDL URL or 'Browse...' to select a local WSDL.
3) Click Test Connection to verify connectivity.
4) Click Finish
NOTE: You may optionally enter a SOAP End Point, if the end point in the WSDL is not to be used. A custom driver class may also be specified, using the optional parameters.

description.b: Follow the steps below to create models using the previously defined connection profile.

subitem.label: Launch the Consume SOAP Web Service Wizard

subitem.description:
1) Select the connection profile, then press Validate WSDL.
2) Select the Port and Service Mode as desired.
3) Select one or more operations under Select the desired WSDL Operations. Click Next >.
4) Select the location and name for the Source and View Models to be created. Click Next >.
5) For each operation, define the request and response XML documents:
--Select the Operation
--Select the Request tab, then select desired element(s) under schema contents and Add to Element Info.
--Select the Response tab, then select desired element(s) under schema contents and Add to Column Info.
--Select the Wrapper Procedure tab to view the generated procedure SQL.
6) When all operation(s) have been defined, click Finish.

description.b: Follow the steps below to create a new VDB

subitem.description:
1) Select "..." button to browse and select project or folder location.
2) Enter a unique name for your VDB
3) Enter an optional description for your VDB
4) Select the Add button to choose models to go in your VDB
5) Click Finish

description.b: Follow the steps below to test the VDB

subitem.description:
1) Select "..." button to browse and select a VDB.
2) Click OK to deploy VDB and open connection in Data Source Explorer
3) Follow instructions in open SQL Scrapbook Editor
4) View your query results in the SQL Results view
